New Records: Seth Lugo tied Atlanta ace Chris Sale and Detroit lefty Tarik Skubal for most wins in the majors.
Key Match Events: Seth Lugo struck out 10 in seven masterful innings
Salvador Perez hit two run-scoring singles to reach 100 RBIs for the second time
Tommy Pham homered and Bobby Witt Jr. had an RBI single
Lugo allowed only three singles and walked none, retiring 17 straight batters after Gleyber Torres' bloop hit to begin the bottom of the first
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone acknowledged Lugo's dominant performance
Seth Lugo emphasized the importance of his performance for the team
Matt Quatraro praised Lugo's pitching clinic
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a potential postseason preview
The Royals won for the fifth time in 13 games overall and improved to 2-4 against the Yankees this season
Michael Lorenzen made a rehab start for the Royals
Others: Kris Bubic and John Schreiber each fanned two in a perfect inning to complete the three-hitter
New York's advantage in the AL East was shaved to a half-game over second-place Baltimore
No. 9 batter Kyle Isbel scored twice after leadoff singles for the Royals
